com.samskivert.util
Class WeakObserverList<T>

java.lang.Object
  java.util.AbstractCollection<E>
      java.util.AbstractList<T>
          com.samskivert.util.WeakObserverList<T>
All Implemented Interfaces:
Iterable<T>, Collection<T>, List<T>
public class WeakObserverList<T>
extends AbstractList<T>

An ObserverList equivalent that does not prevent added observers from being garbage-collected.

Constructor Summary
WeakObserverList(int notifyPolicy)
          Creates an empty observer list with the supplied notification policy and that only allows observers to observe the list once.
WeakObserverList(int notifyPolicy, boolean allowDups)
          Creates an empty observer list with the supplied notification and duplicate observer policy.

 void add(int index, T element)
           
 void apply(ObserverList.ObserverOp<T> obop)
          Applies the supplied observer operation to all observers in the list in a manner conforming to the notification ordering policy specified at construct time.

Constructor Detail

WeakObserverList

public WeakObserverList(int notifyPolicy)
Creates an empty observer list with the supplied notification policy and that only allows observers to observe the list once.

Parameters:
notifyPolicy - Either ObserverList.SAFE_IN_ORDER_NOTIFY or ObserverList.FAST_UNSAFE_NOTIFY.

WeakObserverList

public WeakObserverList(int notifyPolicy,
                        boolean allowDups)
Creates an empty observer list with the supplied notification and duplicate observer policy.

Parameters:
notifyPolicy - Either ObserverList.SAFE_IN_ORDER_NOTIFY or ObserverList.FAST_UNSAFE_NOTIFY.
allowDups - whether to allow observers to be added to the list more than once.
Method Detail

newSafeInOrder

public static <T> WeakObserverList<T> newSafeInOrder()
A convenience method for creating an observer list that avoids duplicating the type parameter on the right hand side.
